Audio Description: This enlistment poster is directed to young women interested in a career in nursing. On the right side of the poster is the profile of a young, blonde haired woman over a gray background. She is wearing a gray beret with a silver Marine Corp insignia with an eagle, and a gray uniform jacket with a red epaulet at the shoulder. There are silver buttons holding the epaulet to the uniform jacket. On her sleeve is the Cadet Nurse insignia of a red cross in a red oval. The letters “US” are stitched in blue on the cross. At the top of the poster are the words printed in black type that read: “Enlist in a proud profession.” The young woman is looking towards blue type on the left side of the poster that read: “Join the U.S. Cadet Nurse Corps.”  In a gray box with rounded corners are the words: “A lifetime education free for high school graduates who qualify. In a red strip at the very bottom of the poster printed in black are the words: “For information go to your local hospital or write U.S. Cadet Nurse Corps, Box 88, New York, N.Y.”
Creator: United States. Federal Security Agency; United States. Cadet Nurse Corps
